description: A novel SCN5A mutation manifests as a malignant form of long QT syndrome.
Congenital long QT syndrome is associated with perinatal onset of tachycardia.
Congenital long QT syndrome is associated with perinatal onset of bradycardia.
The SCN5A gene mutation correlates with episodes of tachycardia.
The SCN5A gene mutation correlates with episodes of bradycardia.
